title: Design Patterns Explained
author: Alan Shalloway & James R. Trott
description: A clear and practical introduction to the most widely used design patterns in software engineering.

title: Artificial Intelligence: A Modern Approach
author: Peter Norvig
description: A brief description of Book Title 2.

title: Debugging Teams
author: Brian Fitzpatrick & Ben Collins-Sussman
description: Offers practical insights into building and managing effective teams that excel in debugging complex software issues.  Focusing heavily on collaboration, communication, and proven strategies to transform the challenges of bug hunting into opportunities for team growth.

title: High-Performance Browser Networking
author: Ilya Grigorik
description: <a href="https://hpbn.co/">This book<a/> provides a hands-on overview of what every web developer needs to know about the various types of networks (WiFi, 3G/4G), transport protocols (UDP, TCP, and TLS), application protocols (HTTP/1.1, HTTP/2), and APIs available in the browser (XHR, WebSocket, WebRTC, and more) to deliver the best—fast, reliable, and resilient—user experience.
